description.para: The isnan() macro returns non-zero if and only if x is a NAN (not a number). NAN is a floating point result which cannot represent by IEEE (Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers) standard.

return.para: _isnan returns a nonzero value (TRUE) if the argument x is NAN; otherwise it returns 0 (FALSE).

remarks.para: The _isnan function tests a given double-precision floating-point value x, returning a nonzero value if x is a NAN. A NAN is generated when the result of a floating-point operation cannot be represented in Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) format. For information about how NAN is represented for output, see printf.
